item.title: Report E-2024090401
item.description:
Report E-2024090401

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-22T09:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-16
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At Veolia's ten-day facility in Henderson, CO, staff identified a leaking trailer in the parking lot storage area. Upon discovery, the trailer was promptly relocated to a loading dock for further inspection and handling. During the offloading process, it was determined that a drum within the trailer had sustained damage. Specifically, a nail puncture had created a pinhole leak at the bottom of the drum. As a result of this damage, approximately one gallon of liquid had escaped. Upon conducting a thorough investigation into the incident, the root cause of the leak was identified. It was discovered that the drum had been compromised due to a structural issue with its supporting pallet. Specifically, a nail was found to be protruding from the pallet on which the drum had been placed. This protruding nail had punctured the bottom of the drum during transit or handling, creating the pinhole leak that led to the subsequent fluid release. Immediate action was taken to address the situation. The compromised drum was placed into an overpack container to prevent any additional leakage. Concurrently, a thorough clean-up operation was conducted to remove all spilled liquid from the affected area, ensuring no residual contamination remained.
